src:
Enfrentamiento entre civiles y Guardia Nacional deja tres muertos en caseta Malpasito
Tres civiles murieron y nueve más resultaron heridos durante un enfrentamiento contra Guardia Nacional y Policía Federal en la caseta Malpasico, en Tabasco
01 Nov 2019, 07:33 by El Debate
Tuxtla Gutiérrez.- Al menos tres personas murieron y nueve más resultaron heridas durante un enfrentamiento entre la Guardia Nacional y civiles que tomaron la caseta de cobro Malpasito, ubicada en el municipio de Huimanguillo, en Tabasco, cerca de la frontera con Chiapas.
Reportes preliminares indican que el incidente se dio cuando un grupo de civiles tomaron control de la caseta Malpasito, la cual se ubica en la carretera Tuxtla Gutiérrez-Las Choapas, y comenzaron a cobrar a los automovilistas para dejarlos pasar.




Usuarios denunciaron a través de redes sociales que sujetos armados con machetes cobraban una cuota de 200 pesos para permitirles pasar por la caseta.



Como parte del llamado "Operativo Águila" acudieron elementos de la Policía Federal y la Guardia Nacional, quienes fueron recibidos a balazos, dando lugar a un enfrentamiento que terminó con tres civiles muertos y nueve heridos, según testigos.
Autoridades de la Fiscalía General del Estado (FGE) tanto de Tabasco como de Chiapas acudieron al lugar a tomar conocimiento de los hechos e iniciar las indagatorias correspondientes.

Policía Federal
text:
Confrontation between civilians and National Guard leaves three dead in Malpasito booth
Three civilians were killed and nine more were injured during a clash against the National Guard and Federal Police at the Malpasico booth in Tabasco
01 Nov 2019, 07:33 by El Debate
Tuxtla Gutiérrez.- At least three people were killed and nine more were injured during a confrontation between the National Guard and civilians who took the Malpasito collection booth, located in the municipality of Huimanguillo, in Tabasco, near the border with Chiapas.
Preliminary reports indicate that the incident occurred when a group of civilians took control of the Malpasito booth, which is located on the Tuxtla Gutiérrez-Las Choapas highway, and began charging motorists to let them pass.




Users reported through social networks that subjects armed with machetes charged a fee of 200 pesos to allow them to go through the booth.



As part of the so-called "Operative Eagle" elements of the Federal Police and the National Guard came, who were shot, resulting in a confrontation that ended with three civilians killed and nine injured, according to witnesses.
Authorities of the State Attorney General's Office (FGE) of both Tabasco and Chiapas came to the place to take cognizance of the facts and initiate the corresponding investigations.








Tabasco


Chiapas


Clashes


National Guard


Federal police
